snippet: With about six weeks to go before a referendum on independence, new powers were pledged for the Scottish Parliament, contingent on a “no” vote.
abstract: Main British political parties, with little more than six weeks to go before referendum on independence for Scotland, promise to grant new fiscal and social security powers to Scots if they decide to keep their union with rest of Britain.
lead_paragraph: With about six weeks to go before a referendum on independence, new powers were pledged for the Scottish Parliament, contingent on a “no” vote.

headline.main: British Parties Try to Entice Scots
headline.print_headline: Britain: Parties Try to Entice Scots
